summary: 17 CFR § 230.502 outlines the general conditions for offers and sales under Regulation D, including integration rules and information disclosure requirements. Issuers must provide specific information to non-accredited investors, such as non-financial and financial statements, depending on the issuer's reporting status and the offering size, while accredited investors may receive less detailed information. The regulation also mandates that issuers make additional information and answers to questions available to purchasers upon request.
